triplets: Herbivorous mammal belonging to the Bovidae family, commonly found in grasslands and savannas
Wildlife viewing, ecological studies, and conservation programs
Horns used for defense and intraspecies combat
Legs adapted for running and jumping to escape predators
Tail used for communication and balance
Hooves that provide traction and support on various terrains
Typically shades of brown or gray, sometimes with white markings or stripes depending on species
Savanna, grassland, and woodland ecosystems; food chain as prey for large predators
Ranges between 30–100 kg depending on species and age
Typically 1–1.5 meters at the shoulder depending on species
10–15 years in the wild; up to 20 years in captivity under protected conditions
